briefdescription.para: Current connection state.
The type of the request, e.g. GET, POST.
Path part of URL for HTTPS connection.
The request body, e.g. form data.
The response body, e.g. file content or JSON.
The reported length of the content. If this is UULONG_MAX, then no length was reported by the server.
Headers for the request, e.g. Authorization, etc.
The status of the HTTP request from the server, e.g. 200 for OK, 404 for not found. A value of 0 means no request has been completed.
Time at which the request should be abandoned.
If true the content is chunked encoding.
Size of current chunk.
Number of bytes received in current chunk.
Headers from the server's response, e.g. RateLimit headers, cookies, etc.
Handle input buffer.

parameterdescription.para: Buffer to read

simplesect.para: returns true if the connection should remain open

briefdescription.para: Start the connection.
Get request state.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &hostname, uint16_t port=443, const std::string &urlpath="/", const std::string &verb="GET", const std::string &req_body="", const http_headers &extra_headers={}, bool plaintext_connection=false, uint16_t request_timeout=5)
memberdef.name: https_client

briefdescription.para: Connect to a specific HTTP(S) server and complete a request.

detaileddescription.para: The constructor will attempt the connection, and return the content. By the time the constructor completes, the HTTP request will be stored in the object.

simplesect.para: This is a blocking call. It starts a loop which runs non-blocking functions within it, but does not return until the request completes. See queues.cpp for how to make this asynchronous.

parameterdescription.para: Hostname to connect to
Port number to connect to, usually 443 for SSL and 80 for plaintext
path part of URL, e.g. "/api"
Request verb, e.g. GET or POST
Request body, use dpp::https_client::build_multipart() to build a multipart MIME body (e.g. for multiple file upload)
Additional request headers, e.g. user-agent, authorization, etc
Set to true to make the connection plaintext (turns off SSL)
How many seconds before the connection is considered failed if not finished

briefdescription.para: Destroy the https client object.
Processes incoming data from the SSL socket input buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer contents. Can modify this value removing the head elements when processed.

briefdescription.para: Close HTTPS socket.
Fires every second from the underlying socket I/O loop, used for timeouts.
Get a HTTP response header.

parameterdescription.para: Header name to find, case insensitive

simplesect.para: Header content or empty string if not found. If multiple values have the same header_name, this will return one of them.
get_header_count to determine if multiple are present
get_header_list to retrieve all entries of the same header_name

briefdescription.para: Get the number of headers with the same header name.

simplesect.para: the number of headers with this count

briefdescription.para: Get a set of HTTP response headers with a common name.

simplesect.para: A list of headers with the same name, or an empty list if not found

briefdescription.para: Get all HTTP response headers.
Get the response content.
Get the response HTTP status, e.g. 200 for OK, 404 for not found, 429 for rate limited. A value of 0 indicates the request was not completed.
Get the bytes out objectGet total bytes sent.
Get total bytes received.
Get SSL cipher name.
Nonblocking I/O loop.

parameterdescription.para: Any std::exception (or derivative) thrown from read_loop() causes reconnection of the shard

briefdescription.para: Write to the output buffer.

parameterdescription.para: Data to be written to the buffer

simplesect.para: The data may not be written immediately and may be written at a later time to the socket.

briefdescription.para: Log a message.

parameterdescription.para: severity of log message
Log message to send

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &json, const std::vector< std::string > &filenames={}, const std::vector< std::string > &contents={}, const std::vector< std::string > &mimetypes={})
memberdef.name: build_multipart

briefdescription.para: Build a multipart content from a set of files and some json.

parameterdescription.para: The json content
File names of files to send
Contents of each of the files to send
MIME types of each of the files to send

briefdescription.para: Break down a scheme, hostname and port into a http_connect_info.

detaileddescription.para: All but the hostname portion are optional. The path component should not be passed to this function.

parameterdescription.para: URL to break down

briefdescription.para: Input buffer received from socket.
Output buffer for sending to socket.
True if in nonblocking mode. The socket switches to nonblocking mode once ReadLoop is called.
Raw file descriptor of connection.
Openssl opaque contexts.
SSL cipher in use.
For timers.
Hostname connected to.
Port connected to.
Bytes out.
Bytes in.
True for a plain text connection.
True if we are establishing a new connection, false if otherwise.
Attaching an additional file descriptor to this function will send notifications when there is data to read.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: Only hook this if you NEED it as it can increase CPU usage of the thread! Returning -1 means that you don't want to be notified.

briefdescription.para: Attaching an additional file descriptor to this function will send notifications when you are able to write to the socket.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: Only hook this if you NEED it as it can increase CPU usage of the thread! You should toggle this to -1 when you do not have anything to write otherwise it'll keep triggering repeatedly (it is level triggered).

briefdescription.para: This event will be called when you can read from the custom fd.
This event will be called when you can write to a custom fd.
True if we are keeping the connection alive after it has finished.
Implements a HTTPS socket client based on the SSL client.

simplesect.para: plaintext HTTP without SSL is also supported via a "downgrade" setting
